main.div: Inserts the given text or element(s) as sibling in front of each element of this list. If a string has been given, it will be added as text node. If you pass an element or a list, it will be inserted only in front of the first element of the list. In order to add elements to several list items, you need to pass a factory function(element, index) thats creates new instances for each item. The function will be invoked for each element and may return either a string for a text node, a simple HTML element or a list containing both.

addBefore() adds text in front of the selected list items. $('#mainText').addBefore('COMMENT'); This results in:
COMMENT Here is some text

You can also pass an element, but note that a node can only be added once to the first list item, even if the list has more than one item: $('#mainText').addBefore(EE('span', {'className': 'important'}, 'WARNING')); With the previous example's HTML, this would create this:
WARNING Here is some text

Lists of elements and nodes are possible as well. Like nodes, it will only be added to the first list item.
$('#status').addBefore([EE('hr'), 'WARNING']);
